translations.terms_terms:
#Terms and Conditions

Welcome to the CrowdLab application part of the “in the moment” research platform for Hall & Partners, trading as CrowdLab. The following sets out the terms of use for the research output (from respondents) and access to research data (by clients).

The CrowdLab mobile application (the "**App**") and the CrowdLab website applications at [https://crowdlab.allchannelsopen.com](https://crowdlab.allchannelsopen.com) (the "**Website**") are owned and operated by Hall and Partners, trading as Crowdlab, a company with registered address Bankside 2, 100 Southwark Street, London SE1 0SW and company number 2733595 ("CrowdLab", "H&P", "Hall & Partners", “we”, "us" or "our"). These rules are the terms and conditions that you must agree to in order to use the App and the Website (the “**Rules**”) and by using the App or the Website, you acknowledge that you have read and understood these Rules and agree to be bound by them.

##Use of Respondent Data

In line with terms agreed to by each respondent, CrowdLab has obtained consent for data to be processed for the strict use by CrowdLab and the end client for the business uses in connection with the named market research project.

##User Obligations

The User agrees not to copy, download, print, use, distribute, publish or otherwise make available any respondent image, footage, text that could identify them or any other personal data viewed on the online site. Use of this data for any other purpose not agreed with CrowdLab, or transfer to the public domain, or parties outside the client organisation cannot be done without the prior written consent of CrowdLab and only if each respondent whose identifiable data is included has given their consent.

The User agrees to uphold the terms of this agreement and also agrees to ensure all personnel that may have access to the CrowdLab site are made aware of the contents of this agreement. The client agrees to store any research output received that contains personal data securely and in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) guidelines.

##Access to CrowdLab

In order to access the CrowdLab platform, each user must be registered with a CrowdLab account. When creating your account, you must provide accurate and complete information and you must keep this information up to date. You are solely responsible for the activity that occurs on your account.     

Users who are in receipt of a log-in and password to access the platform must not share their assigned log-in details with anyone else and must agree to the terms and conditions before entering.

You must notify CrowdLab immediately of any breach of security or unauthorised use of your account.

The client has permission to use a secure log-in to the CrowdLab site to view output strictly in connection only with the named project and only for the purpose of observing research findings over the course of the project.

The respondents have permission to access the apps related to the collection of data. They do not have access to other projects or user accounts and cannot view other respondent’s data unless specifically required as part of the project.


##Privacy

CrowdLab cares about the privacy of our users and by using the CrowdLab platform you are agreeing to the collection and processing of Personal Data as set out in the Privacy Policy. The privacy policy also outlines your rights under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).    

*  When you register to use the App, we collect certain personal data to allow you to log into and use the App and the Website.  Details of the personal data that we collect about you are contained in the Privacy Policy.

*  When you create and submit content using the App or the Website, such content is collected on behalf of the CrowdLab client responsible for the market research in which you are participating. Details of data being processed can be found in the CrowdLab Privacy Policy. 

*  In order to maintain the accuracy of our database, you can check, update or remove your personal details by reviewing your data at [https://crowdlab.allchannelsopen.com]( https://crowdlab.allchannelsopen.com), and sending us an email with your update requests. All requests will be actioned within a reasonable timeframe and as long as the project is still within the retention period of 6 months after close of the project. Please contact us at the above address for further details or to make a request. 

*  Personal information may be transferred to affiliated companies or non-affiliated services providers for research-related purposes, such as the fulfilment of prize draws or other incentives. We require these companies safeguard all personal information in a way that is consistent with CrowdLab measures and as regulated by the GDPR legislation and the MRS Code of Conduct.

##Security

We are committed to ensuring that your information is secure. In order to prevent unauthorised access or disclosure, we have put in place suitable physical, electronic and managerial procedures to safeguard and secure the information we collect online. We follow strict security procedures in the storage and disclosure of information which you have given us, to prevent unauthorised access in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

##How we use cookies

A cookie is a small file which is installed on your computer by a website to help analyse web traffic or let you know when you visit a particular site. Cookies allow web applications to respond to you as an individual. The web application can tailor its operations to your needs, likes and dislikes by gathering and remembering information about your preferences.

We use traffic log cookies to identify which pages are being used. This helps us analyse data about web page traffic and improve our website in order to tailor it to customer needs. We only use this information for statistical analysis purposes and then the data is removed from the system.


##CrowdLab Rules

###Last Updated: 3rd April 2019

The CrowdLab mobile application (the "**App**") and the CrowdLab website applications at [https://crowdlab.allchannelsopen.com](https://crowdlab.allchannelsopen.com) (the "**Website**") are owned and operated by Hall and Partners, trading as Crowdlab, a company with registered address Bankside 2, 100 Southwark Street, London SE1 0SW and company number 2733595 ("CrowdLab", "H&P", "Hall & Partners", “we”, "us" or "our"). These rules are the terms and conditions that you must agree to in order to use the App and the Website (the “**Rules**”) and by using the App or the Website, you acknowledge that you have read and understood these Rules and agree to be bound by them.

###1. Age Restrictions

To use the App and the Website you must be over the age of 16, unless we have specifically obtained consent from your parent or legal guardian.
If you are younger than 16:

*  You must ensure your mother, father or guardian have signed a consent at the point of recruitment, and that they have consented to the use of the App, and the Website.  Your details, and all of your responses will be deleted with immediate effect if the necessary consent has not been granted.

*  If you are a mother, father or guardian of a user of the App or the Website who is under 16 then you must agree to these Rules in respect of yourself and your child and make sure that your child understands and complies with them. Unless you agree that your child can use the App and the Website without supervision, you must supervise your child's use of the App and the Website at all times. You are responsible for your child's use of the App and the Website (supervised or unsupervised).

*  Following receipt via the recruiter confirming parental permission for you to use the App and the Website, we will cease to be liable to you for any processing of your data without consent and your parent becomes liable to ensure your compliance with these Rules.

###2. Using the App and Website and Creating Content

*  We respect your responsibility for the content you choose to share with us. However, when using the App or Website or when creating the content, you must agree to the following rules of use:

	* Only submit personal information about your friends, family or other people (such as their names or ages) or photographs, video recordings or audio recordings of your friends, family or other people to the App and the Website where you have their prior consent to do so.

	* Do not create or submit any content to the App or the Website which has not been created by you.

	* Do not disclose your password to anyone, except where you and others within your household are recruited to participate together in a market research project in which case you may share your password with such other people.

	* Do not say anything about anyone or anything that is not true.

	* Do not say anything that is illegal, offensive, pornographic, rude, racist, sexist, ageist, discriminatory, abusive or defamatory or detrimental to the nature of the product you are discussing without due cause and don’t encourage any of these activities.

	* Do not knowingly introduce any viruses or other material which is malicious or technologically harmful to the App or the Website.

	* Do not say anything that is deliberately meant to upset anyone else.

	* Do not use obscene or vulgar language.

	* Do not use the identity of anyone else.

	* Do not use anyone else's confidential information in the content you submit.

	* Do not offer to buy, sell or trade anything.

	* If you are a child, you must not give details about what school you go to or your address and you must tell your parents or guardian straight away. You should also check out the Childnet International website [https://www.childnet.com]( https://www.childnet.com) which will tell you about the dangers of using the internet.

*  You may not engage in any form of commercial advertising.  This does not include references to businesses for non-promotional purposes including references to third party brands and advertising as part of your responses to the market research in which you are participating.

*  You are only allowed to use the App and the Website for the purposes of submitting the content to us. You are not allowed to use the App or the Website for any other purpose. The contents of the briefs and tasks that you will receive via the App or the Website are strictly confidential. 

###3. Ending Your Use of the App and Website

*  We may stop you from using the App and the Website, or ask you to stop using the App and the Website, at any time. This may be by disabling your account or by giving you a notice (for example, sending you an email) to stop using the App and the Website. We may also delete the content you submit at any time if we, in our sole discretion, consider this appropriate.

*  You promise not to access the App or the Website or attempt to re-register with us if you have been stopped from, or asked to stop, using the App and the Website.

###4. Ownership of the App, the Website and Content You Submit

*  The content of the App and the Website, including all pictures, graphics, words, buttons, icons, moving images, music and sound and the presentation, selection and arrangement of the same belong to us or our licensors and assignors from time to time. You may not copy or use any of it other than directly as part of the normal use of the App or the Website.

*  The content you create and submit using the App or the Website will belong to you. You have certain rights when it comes to your data which have been outlined in the Privacy Policy 

*  You agree to waive all moral rights in respect of the content you create and submit using the App or the Website.  

###5. Changes

*  We may alter, remove or withdraw the App or the Website or any part of it (including anything that you add to it) at any time for any reason, with or without telling you.

*  We may change these Rules at any time. You must make a note of the “Last Updated” date at the top of this page and check back regularly for updates. We will ask you to accept the Terms & Conditions again when changes have been made. 

###6. Liability

*  THE APP AND THE WEBSITE IS PROVIDED “AS IS” AND "AS AVAILABLE", without any representation or endorsement made and without warranty of any kind whether express or implied, including but not limited to the implied warranties of satisfactory quality, fitness for a particular purpose, non-infringement of any third party intellectual property rights or any law in any jurisdiction, compatibility, security and accuracy. Errors may appear in the App or the Website and there may be delays in downloading the App, outages of the Website or delays in uploading or downloading the content. Any products or services which we ask you to provide comments on are those of our clients and we do not accept any liability for them nor should any part of the App or the Website constitute advice in any way regarding such products or services and cannot be relied on. Your download of the App is at your own risk. 

*  The App and access to the Website is provided to you free of charge and as such it is reasonable for us to exclude and limit our liability to you as follows. To the fullest extent permitted by law, WE SHALL NOT BE LIABLE TO YOU FOR ANY LOSSES, COSTS OR EXPENSES that you suffer because of or in connection with your use of the App or the Website even if we have been advised of and should have foreseen the possibility of such loss. 

*  Without prejudice to the exclusions of liability included above, our total liability to you arising under or in connection with these Rules no matter how fundamental (including by reason of our negligence) shall be limited to £50.

*  Notwithstanding any contrary provision in this Agreement, we do not limit or exclude or liability in respect of: any death or personal injury caused by our negligence; any fraud; and any statutory or other liability which cannot be excluded under applicable law. 

*  The Internet is not secure. Sometimes, internet service providers or other third parties can and do intercept for legitimate and illegitimate purposes. We will not be liable to you for any losses, costs or expenses that you suffer because of this or any other action or inaction of any third party.

*  We cannot guarantee that the App or the Website is free from computer viruses or malware. You must use adequate and up to date anti-virus and anti-malware software when accessing the App or the Website.

*  You agree to be responsible for, and pay back to us, any losses, costs or expenses that we suffer or incur as a result of you failing to comply with these Rules.

###7. Other Terms

*  Other terms and conditions may apply where stated, for example for competitions. 

*  You:

	* may link to the homepage of the Website, provided you do so in a way that is fair and legal and does not damage our reputation;

	* must not establish a link to the Website which suggests any form of association with, approval of or endorsement by us; and

	* must not establish a link to the Website in any website that is not owned by you.

*  The Website must not be framed on any other site, nor may you create a link to any part of the Website other than the home page.  We reserve the right to withdraw linking permission without notice.

*  If any part of these Rules is, at any time, found to be invalid by a court, tribunal or other forum of competent jurisdiction, or otherwise rendered unenforceable, that decision shall not invalidate or void the remainder of these Rules. These Rules shall be deemed amended by modifying or severing such part as necessary to render them valid, legal and enforceable while preserving their intent, or if that is not possible, by substituting another provision that is valid, legal and enforceable that gives equivalent effect to their intent.

*  You may not assign, sub-license or otherwise transfer your rights under these Rules.

###8. Law

*  You agree that these Rules are governed by and shall be construed in accordance with the laws of England and Wales (including any non-contractual obligations arising out of them). You agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of England and Wales as regards any claim, dispute or matter arising out of these Rules whether contractual or non-contractual.

##Contacting Us

*  If you have any questions or comments or complaints about these Rules, the App or the Website we would love to hear from you. You can contact us as follows:

	* By email to: [support@crowdlab.com](mailto:support@crowdlab.com)

	* By post to: Bankside 2, 100 Southwark Street, London SE1 0SW

#Privacy Policy

**This privacy policy is provided by CrowdLab. We take very seriously the privacy of any personal information we collect from you.**

The purpose of this privacy policy is to describe how and when the CrowdLab platform collects, uses and shares your personal data. It aims to set out the principles governing our use of the personal information that we may obtain about you when you use the platform. By creating or logging into your CrowdLab account, you agree to this use, so we ask you to read this privacy policy carefully.

We may change our privacy policy from time to time. We therefore ask you to check it occasionally to ensure that you are aware of the most recent version that will apply each time you access the platform.

##**Personal Information Collection and Use**

We may gather various types of information, including information that identifies or may identify you as an individual (“Personal Data”) as explained in more detail below.

###Information You Provide to Us:

*  Basic account information. We require all participants and researchers to log into the platform and provide certain Personal Data (such as email address, username and password) in order to register with the platform and save your account 

*  Profile information. We request certain additional Personal Data (such as age, gender, a nickname and profile pictures) to be added to your profile.  

*  Participant response information. We may collect Personal Data when you participate in a market research project through the CrowdLab platform. In this context, you may choose to provide sensitive Personal Data about you, such as Personal Data that discloses or reveals health and medical conditions, sexual orientation or sexual life, political opinions/views, race/ethnic origin, religious and philosophical beliefs and trade-union membership. Where required by law, we obtain your explicit consent to the processing of your sensitive Personal Data.
 
*  Media. We may also collect media content that you submit, upload or transmit when using the Platform, such as photos, audio recording and videos which may contain Personal Data. 

###Information We Automatically Collect:

*  Device information. We may collect certain information related to your device, such as your device’s IP address, unique device identifiers, mobile device information, operating system, browser type and date and time of access. This is used to for the purpose of optimising your experience, data for authentication and quality purposes.

*  Location information. Your devices may also transmit location information (depending on user permission and settings) which may be used to supplement the response data.

*  Log information. We also collect log information related to how and when you use the platform in order to trouble shoot issues, maintain the system and protect our users

###Information collected by Third Parties:

*  Personal Data may be processed through third party service providers, such as Rollbar, Crashlytics, Zencoder and Amazon Web Services. These services are used by CrowdLab to host the platform and support system processes. 

###How do we use the information collected?

*  Any data that we collect during a CrowdLab project will be used solely for the research purpose agreed with our clients. Under GDPR the legal basis for processing of this data is ‘legitimate business interest’ 

*  Any Personal Information or Sensitive Personal Data collected during a CrowdLab project will be used solely for the research purpose agreed with our clients, but we will obtain consent before collecting, and these questions can be refused. Under GDPR the legal basis for processing of this data is ‘consent’. Where our use of your personal information requires your consent, you can provide such consent by following the instructions provided at the time we collect your personal information.

### Automated Decision Making / Profiling

*  Based on the information you may give through participation in a project, we may carry out automated decision making or profiling about you. In most of cases this will not result in any legally significant decisions being made about you and will be used in a market research context only. Under GDPR the legal basis for processing of this data is ‘legitimate business interest’.

##Exercise Your Rights

You have the following rights in relation to the personal information we hold about you:

*  **Your right of access**. If you ask us, we’ll confirm whether we’re processing your personal information and, if so, provide you with a copy of that personal information (along with certain other details). You can access your response data at [https://crowdlab.allchannelsopen.com](https://crowdlab.allchannelsopen.com) using your CrowdLab login credentials.

*  **Your right to rectification**. If the personal information we hold about you is inaccurate or incomplete, you’re entitled to have it rectified. If we’ve shared your personal information with others, we’ll let them know about the rectification where possible. If you ask us, where possible and lawful to do so, we’ll also tell you who we’ve shared your personal information with so that you can contact them directly. 

*  **Your right to erasure**. You can ask us to delete or remove your personal information in some circumstances such as where we no longer need it or if you withdraw your consent (where applicable). If we’ve shared your personal information with others, we’ll let them know about the erasure where possible. If you ask us, where it is possible and lawful for us to do so, we’ll also tell you who we’ve shared your personal information with so that you can contact them directly.

*  **Your right to restrict processing**. You can ask us to ‘block’ or suppress the processing of your personal information in certain circumstances such as where you contest the accuracy of that personal information or you object to us processing it. It won’t stop us from storing your personal information though. We’ll tell you before we lift any restriction. If we’ve shared your personal information with others, we’ll let them know about the restriction where it is possible for us to do so. If you ask us, where it is possible and lawful for us to do so, we’ll also tell you who we’ve shared your personal information with so that you can contact them directly. 

*  **Your right to data portability**. With effect from 25 May 2018, you have the right, in certain circumstances, to obtain personal information you’ve provided us with (in a structured, commonly used and machine readable format) and to reuse it elsewhere or to ask us to transfer this to a third party of your choice.

*  **Your right to object**. You can ask us to stop processing your personal information, and we will do so, if we are:
	* relying on our own or someone else’s legitimate interests to process your personal information, except if we can demonstrate compelling legal grounds for the processing; or
	* processing your personal information for direct marketing. 

*  **Your rights in relation to automated decision-making and profiling**. You have the right not to be subject to a decision when it’s based on automatic processing, including profiling, if it produces a legal effect or similarly significantly affects you, unless such profiling is necessary for entering into, or the performance of, a contract between you and us.

*  **Your right to withdraw consent**. If we rely on your consent (or explicit consent) as our legal basis for processing your personal information, you have the right to withdraw that consent at any time.

*  **Your right to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority**. If you have a concern about any aspect of our privacy practices, including the way we’ve handled your personal information, you can report it to the UK Information Commissioner’s Office (ICO). You can find details about how to do this on the ICO website at [https://ico.org.uk/concerns/](https://ico.org.uk/concerns/) or by calling their helpline on 0303 123 1113. 

If you would like to access, review, update, rectify, and delete any Personal Information we hold about you, or exercise any other data subject right available to you under the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), contact us at [DPO@crowdlab.com](mailto:DPO@crowdlab.com).  Our privacy team will examine your request and respond to you as quickly as possible.

Please note that we may still use any aggregated and de-identified Personal Information that does not identify any individual, and may also retain and use your information as necessary to comply with our legal obligations, resolve disputes, and enforce our agreements.

##Where We Store Data

The data that we collect from you may be transferred to, stored at and processed at a destination outside the European Economic Area ("EEA"). It may also be processed by staff operating outside the EEA who work for us or for one of our suppliers. If we transfer data for processing to a country outside of the EEA, we will put in additional safeguards to protect your personal data based on standard contractual clauses and data protection laws.

Some of our third party service providers are located in the USA and their use of your personal information is governed by EU-US Privacy Shield.

##Data Retention 

We keep Personal Data for just as long as necessary for the purpose for which it is being processed. After the CrowdLab project is closed data availability will be restricted and minimised over 6 months. 

At the end of the 6 months (subject to client approval), all the personal data, project responses and system log information will have been automatically deleted and no longer retrievable. 

##Security

We have a commitment to taking reasonable steps to ensure the security of your information. To prevent unauthorized access, maintain data accuracy, and ensure the appropriate use of information, we use appropriate technical, organizational and administrative security measures to protect any information we hold in our records from loss, misuse, and unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration and destruction.

##Children's Privacy

Protecting the privacy of the young, i.e. children under the age of 16, is especially important. For that reason, we never knowingly invite children under the age of 16 years to participate in research studies without consent and we will take measures to gain permission by the responsible adult. If Personal Data about a child has been provided to us without proper consent, we ask that a parent or guardian of the child contact us at [DPO@crowdlab.com](DPO@crowdlab.com) if they would like that information deleted from our database. We will use all reasonable efforts to delete such information from our database.

##Privacy Precautionary Warning

Please note that no data transmission over the Internet is 100% secure. As a result, we cannot guarantee the security of the information that you transmit via our online services. Please note that we reserve the right to access and/or disclose the user information discussed herein (including personal information) as required by courts and/or administrative agencies and to the extent required to permit us to investigate suspected fraud, harassment or other violations of law or our Site Terms of Use or policies.

##Cookies And Other Tracking Activities

A cookie is a small piece of data (text file) that a website – when visited by a user – asks your browser to store on your device in order to remember information about you, such as your language preference or login information. Those cookies are set by us and called first party cookies. We also use third party cookies – which are cookies from a domain different than the domain of the website you are visiting – for our advertising and marketing efforts.

More specifically, we use cookies and other tracking technologies for the following purposes:

*  Assisting you in navigation;

*  Assisting in registration to our events, login, and your ability to provide feedback;

*  Analysing your use of our products, services or applications;

*  Assisting with our promotional and marketing efforts (including behavioural advertising).

Our Website is scanned with our cookie scanning tool regularly to maintain a list as accurate as possible. We classify cookies in the following categories:

*  Strictly Necessary Cookies
*  Performance Cookies
*  Functional Cookies
*  Targeting Cookies

##Google Analytics:

We also utilize Google Analytics, a web analysis service provided by Google, to better understand your use of our Websites and Services. Google Analytics collects information such as how often users visit the Websites, what pages they visit and what other sites they used prior to visiting. Google uses the data collected to track and examine the use of the Websites, to prepare reports on its activities and share them with other Google services. Google may use the data collected on the Websites to contextualize and personalize the ads of its own advertising network. Google’s ability to use and share information collected by Google Analytics about your visits to the Websites is restricted by the [Google Analytics Terms of Use](https://www.google.com/analytics/terms/us.html) and the [Google Privacy Policy](https://www.google.com/policies/privacy/).

Google offers an opt-out mechanism for the web available here.

##More Information

For additional information about our privacy policy, please contact our Data Protection Officer on [DPO@crowdlab.com](DPO@crowdlab.com) 

This document was last updated on 04th April 2019.

#PRIVACY POLICY 
**This privacy policy is provided by Hall & Partners, trading as CrowdLab. We take very seriously the privacy of any personal information we collect from you.**
The purpose of this privacy policy is to describe how and when the CrowdLab platform collects, uses and shares your personal data. It aims to set out the principles governing our use of the personal information that we may obtain about you when you use the platform. By creating or logging into your CrowdLab account, you agree to this use, so we ask you to read this privacy policy carefully.
We may change our privacy policy from time to time. We therefore ask you to check it occasionally to ensure that you are aware of the most recent version that will apply each time you access the platform.
##PERSONAL INFORMATION COLLECTION AND USE**
We may gather various types of information, including information that identifies or may identify you as an individual (“Personal Data”) as explained in more detail below.
###**Information You Provide to Us:**
•	Basic account information. We require all participants and researchers to log into the platform and provide certain Personal Data (such as email address, username and password) in order to register with the platform and save your account 
•	Profile information. We request certain additional Personal Data (such as age, gender, a nickname and profile pictures) to be added to your profile.  
•	Participant response information. We may collect Personal Data when you participate in a market research project through the CrowdLab platform. In this context, you may choose to provide sensitive Personal Data about you, such as Personal Data that discloses or reveals health and medical conditions, sexual orientation or sexual life, political opinions/views, race/ethnic origin, religious and philosophical beliefs and trade-union membership. Where required by law, we obtain your explicit consent to the processing of your sensitive Personal Data. 
•	Media. We may also collect media content that you submit, upload or transmit when using the Platform, such as photos, audio recording and videos which may contain Personal Data. 
###Information We Automatically Collect:
•	Device information. We may collect certain information related to your device, such as your device’s IP address, unique device identifiers, mobile device information, operating system, browser type and date and time of access. This is used to for the purpose of optimising your experience, data for authentication and quality purposes.
•	Location information. Your devices may also transmit location information (depending on user permission and settings) which may be used to supplement the response data.
•	Log information. We also collect log information related to how and when you use the platform in order to trouble shoot issues, maintain the system and protect our users
###Information collected by Third Parties:
•	Personal Data may be processed through third party service providers, such as Rollbar, Firebase: Crashlytics, Cloud Messaging, Performance Monitoring, and Google Analytics for Firebase, Zencoder and Amazon Web Services. These services are used by CrowdLab to host the platform and support system processes. 
###How do we use the information collected?
•	Any data that we collect during a CrowdLab project will be used solely for the research purpose agreed with our clients. Under GDPR the legal basis for processing of this data is ‘legitimate business interest’ 
•	Any Personal Information or Sensitive Personal Data collected during a CrowdLab project will be used solely for the research purpose agreed with our clients, but we will obtain consent before collecting, and these questions can be refused. Under GDPR the legal basis for processing of this data is ‘consent’. Where our use of your personal information requires your consent, you can provide such consent by following the instructions provided at the time we collect your personal information.
### Automated Decision Making / Profiling
•	Based on the information you may give through participation in a project, we may carry out automated decision making or profiling about you. In most of cases this will not result in any legally significant decisions being made about you and will be used in a market research context only. Under GDPR the legal basis for processing of this data is ‘legitimate business interest’.
##EXERCISE YOUR RIGHTS
You have the following rights in relation to the personal information we hold about you:
•	**Your right of access**. If you ask us, we’ll confirm whether we’re processing your personal information and, if so, provide you with a copy of that personal information (along with certain other details). You can access your response data at [https://crowdlab.allchannelsopen.com]( https://crowdlab.allchannelsopen.com) using your CrowdLab login credentials.

•	**Your right to rectification**. If the personal information we hold about you is inaccurate or incomplete, you’re entitled to have it rectified. If we’ve shared your personal information with others, we’ll let them know about the rectification where possible. If you ask us, where possible and lawful to do so, we’ll also tell you who we’ve shared your personal information with so that you can contact them directly. 

•	**Your right to erasure**. You can ask us to delete or remove your personal information in some circumstances such as where we no longer need it or if you withdraw your consent (where applicable). If we’ve shared your personal information with others, we’ll let them know about the erasure where possible. If you ask us, where it is possible and lawful for us to do so, we’ll also tell you who we’ve shared your personal information with so that you can contact them directly.

•	**Your right to restrict processing**. You can ask us to ‘block’ or suppress the processing of your personal information in certain circumstances such as where you contest the accuracy of that personal information or you object to us processing it. It won’t stop us from storing your personal information though. We’ll tell you before we lift any restriction. If we’ve shared your personal information with others, we’ll let them know about the restriction where it is possible for us to do so. If you ask us, where it is possible and lawful for us to do so, we’ll also tell you who we’ve shared your personal information with so that you can contact them directly. 

•	**Your right to data portability**. With effect from 25 May 2018, you have the right, in certain circumstances, to obtain personal information you’ve provided us with (in a structured, commonly used and machine readable format) and to reuse it elsewhere or to ask us to transfer this to a third party of your choice.

•	**Your right to object**. You can ask us to stop processing your personal information, and we will do so, if we are:
o	relying on our own or someone else’s legitimate interests to process your personal information, except if we can demonstrate compelling legal grounds for the processing; or
o	processing your personal information for direct marketing. 

•	**Your rights in relation to automated decision-making and profiling**. You have the right not to be subject to a decision when it’s based on automatic processing, including profiling, if it produces a legal effect or similarly significantly affects you, unless such profiling is necessary for entering into, or the performance of, a contract between you and us.

•	**Your right to withdraw consent**. If we rely on your consent (or explicit consent) as our legal basis for processing your personal information, you have the right to withdraw that consent at any time.

•	**Your right to lodge a complaint with the supervisory authority**. If you have a concern about any aspect of our privacy practices, including the way we’ve handled your personal information, you can report it to the UK Information Commissioner’s Office (ICO). You can find details about how to do this on the ICO website at [https://ico.org.uk/concerns/](https://ico.org.uk/concerns/) or by calling their helpline on 0303 123 1113. 
If you would like to access, review, update, rectify, and delete any Personal Information we hold about you, or exercise any other data subject right available to you under the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), contact us at [DPO@crowdlab.com](mailto:DPO@crowdlab.com).  Our privacy team will examine your request and respond to you as quickly as possible.
Please note that we may still use any aggregated and de-identified Personal Information that does not identify any individual, and may also retain and use your information as necessary to comply with our legal obligations, resolve disputes, and enforce our agreements.
##WHERE WE STORE DATA
The data that we collect from you may be transferred to, stored at and processed at a destination outside the European Economic Area ("EEA"). It may also be processed by staff operating outside the EEA who work for us or for one of our suppliers. If we transfer data for processing to a country outside of the EEA, we will put in additional safeguards to protect your personal data based on standard contractual clauses and data protection laws.
Some of our third party service providers are located in the USA and their use of your personal information is governed by EU-US Privacy Shield.
##DATA RETENTION 
We keep Personal Data for just as long as necessary for the purpose for which it is being processed. After the CrowdLab project is closed data availability will be restricted and minimised over 6 months. 
At the end of the 6 months (subject to client approval), all the personal data, project responses and system log information will have been automatically deleted and no longer retrievable. 
##SECURITY
We have a commitment to taking reasonable steps to ensure the security of your information. To prevent unauthorized access, maintain data accuracy, and ensure the appropriate use of information, we use appropriate technical, organizational and administrative security measures to protect any information we hold in our records from loss, misuse, and unauthorized access, disclosure, alteration and destruction.
##CHILDREN'S PRIVACY
Protecting the privacy of the young, i.e. children under the age of 16, is especially important. For that reason, we never knowingly invite children under the age of 16 years to participate in research studies without consent and we will take measures to gain permission by the responsible adult. If Personal Data about a child has been provided to us without proper consent, we ask that a parent or guardian of the child contact us at [DPO@crowdlab.com](DPO@crowdlab.com) if they would like that information deleted from our database. We will use all reasonable efforts to delete such information from our database.
##PRIVACY PRECAUTIONARY WARNING
Please note that no data transmission over the Internet is 100% secure. As a result, we cannot guarantee the security of the information that you transmit via our online services. Please note that we reserve the right to access and/or disclose the user information discussed herein (including personal information) as required by courts and/or administrative agencies and to the extent required to permit us to investigate suspected fraud, harassment or other violations of law or our Site Terms of Use or policies.
##COOKIES AND OTHER TRACKING ACTIVITIES
A cookie is a small piece of data (text file) that a website – when visited by a user – asks your browser to store on your device in order to remember information about you, such as your language preference or login information. Those cookies are set by us and called first party cookies. We also use third party cookies – which are cookies from a domain different than the domain of the website you are visiting – for our advertising and marketing efforts.
More specifically, we use cookies and other tracking technologies for the following purposes:
•	Assisting you in navigation;
•	Assisting in registration to our events, login, and your ability to provide feedback;
•	Analysing your use of our products, services or applications;
•	Assisting with our promotional and marketing efforts (including behavioural advertising).
Our Website is scanned with our cookie scanning tool regularly to maintain a list as accurate as possible. We classify cookies in the following categories:
•	Strictly Necessary Cookies
•	Performance Cookies
•	Functional Cookies
•	Targeting Cookies

##Google Analytics:
We also utilize Google Analytics, a web analysis service provided by Google, to better understand your use of our Websites and Services. Google Analytics collects information such as how often users visit the Websites, what pages they visit and what other sites they used prior to visiting. Google uses the data collected to track and examine the use of the Websites, to prepare reports on its activities and share them with other Google services. Google may use the data collected on the Websites to contextualize and personalize the ads of its own advertising network. Google’s ability to use and share information collected by Google Analytics about your visits to the Websites is restricted by the [https://www.google.com/analytics/terms/us.html](Google Analytics Terms of Use) and the [https://www.google.com/policies/privacy/ ](Google Privacy Policy).
Google offers an opt-out mechanism for the web available [https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout/](here).
##MORE INFORMATION
For additional information about our privacy policy, please contact our Data Protection Officer on [DPO@crowdlab.com](DPO@crowdlab.com)
